alert.note: Alert for Cherry; Sheridan (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 09 at 1:00AM CDT until May 09 at 6:00AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM MDT FOR NORTHWESTERN CHERRY AND NORTHEASTERN SHERIDAN COUNTIES... At 1200 AM MDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Gordon to 27 miles east of Rushville to 25 miles north of Ashby, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Gordon, Merriman, Clinton, Highway 61 crossing the Snake River, Big Hill, Morgan Lake, Lone Butte, Irwin, Highway 27 crossing the Niobrara River, Intersection of Highway 20 and Irwin Road, Shell Lake State Wildlife Management Area, Rock Hill, Bayonne, Intersection of Highway 27 and Mills Road, Round Lake, Highway 61 Crossing The Niobrara River and Intersection of Highway 61 and Shadbolt Road. This includes the following highways... Highway 20 between mile markers 96 and 136. Highway 61 between mile markers 187 and 228, and near mile marker 230. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
